title: American_Top_40_1972_April_8th
description:
"From the salty gray Atlantic to the salty blue Pacific, these are the 40 best-selling records of the week."


American Top 40 with Casey Kasem aired on radio from July 4, 1970 until August 6, 1988. This recording is a rebroadcast from internet radio.

In this countdown:

Because of the Vietnam War draft, 1972 was to be the first presidential election where 18 to 20 year-old Americans were eligible to vote. Casey encourages voter registration in each hour of the show.

Two songs debut so high in the top 40 that they are in the second hour of the show: "Baby Blue" by Badfinger (at number 26) and "Doctor My Eyes" by Jackson Browne (at number 24).

A listener wants to know what artist or group has had the most number one albums. Casey says this group has 14 number one albums in a span of just six years.

There is a song that Casey says was banned in Ireland at the time.

Casey gets a letter which asks, "What was the most controversial song ever to become a hit?" Without answering directly, he recalls some songs about insanity, Vietnam atrocities, suicide, and cannibalism.

40: King Heroin - James Brown
39: Take A Look Around - The Temptations
38: Help Me Make It Through The Night - Gladys Knight & The Pips
37: Ain't Understanding Mellow - Jerry Butler and Brenda Lee Egger
36: Got To Get It On Again - The Adrisi Brothers
35: Slippin' Into Darkness - War
34: Let It On (Get It On) - T-Rex
33: Look What You Done For Me - Al Green
32: Jump Into The Fire - Nilsson
31: Precious And Few - Climax
30: Do Your Thing - Isaac Hayes
29: Suavecito - Malo
28: Every Day Of My Life - Bobby Vinton
27: Family Of Man - Three Dog Night
26: Baby Blue - Badfinger
25: Vincent - Don Mclean
24: Doctor My Eyes - Jackson Browne

22: Crazy Mama - J.J. Cale
21: Give Ireland Back To The Irish - Wings
20: Down By The Lazy River - The Osmonds
19: Taurus - Dennis Coffey & The Detroit Guitar Band
18: Everything I Own - Bread
17: Without You - Nilsson
16: The Way Of Love - Cher
15: Rock And Roll Lullaby - B.J. Thomas
14: Roundabout - Yes
13: A Cowboy's Work Is Never Done - Sonny & Cher
12: Daydreaming - Aretha Franklin
11: Betcha By Golly Wow - Stylistics
10: The Lion Sleeps Tonight - Robert John
9: In The Rain - The Dramatics
8: Jungle Fever - The Chakachas
7: Mother And Child Reunion - Paul Simon

5: Rockin' Robin - Michael Jackson

2: Heart Of Gold - Neil Young
SPECIAL: All Shook Up - Elvis Presley
1: A Horse With No Name - America
